column4: hello all. How come when I make a new user they can read and open my files in my directory?
because by default your home has 755 permissions

thanks, although I still don't know what to do with the permissions without messing up everything permissions wise. Is it just to change the permission on the home directory it self (non-recursively) or is it changing my user's permissions?
to avoid others being able to read my home dir, could I just make the directory "/home/userfolder" 750 ?
